I didn't feel well today, so I didn't leave the house until around 5:30 when I had to hit my Lab. As a result, I didn't even realize what a lovely day it was out.  Fall is in the air. The crisp, cool days are coming and I love it.  The cusp of fall is the most beautiful time of year. Not to hot, not yet cold, the leaves are still green and lush, but that fabulous smell is in the air. <3 Huzzah for fall!

I amaze myself sometimes. My Dad sends me meat for gifts, he's worried I don't get enough protein, so the last time (Easter) he sent me bacon wrapped tenderloins. Well, decided to eat areally tasty meal including said meat. I followed the cooking instructions, and set the oven on broil, with the steak 2-3 inches from the heat source for the first 5 minutes....I walked away for a few minutes, and when I came back the oven was smoking and there was a fire inside. Apparently, the bacon fat had somehow ignited and was on fire. I grabbed the extinguisher, but reluctant to lose my steak I thought for a moment. If I opened the door, more air would get in and the fire may spread, plus I would have to hose my steak. Buuuuuttt, if I let the fat just burn out while watching it closely, extinguisher in hand, the fuel source would hopefully burn out.

Sure enough, it finally ran out of bacon grease, and when I took my steak out, it was actually perfectly cooked!

Huzzah for calm in the face of emergencies.

In other news, the Kittens are growing like weeds. Ashlan has claimed one, which I'm so happy about because she works with me and I know she'll be an awesome home. Tons of photos of all the kittens are on facebook if anyone wants to see. ^^

I Am A: True Neutral Human Druid (3rd Level)

Ability Scores:
Strength-14
Dexterity-14
Constitution-12
Intelligence-15
Wisdom-14
Charisma-13

Alignment:
True Neutral A true neutral character does what seems to be a good idea. He doesn't feel strongly one way or the other when it comes to good vs. evil or law vs. chaos. Most true neutral characters exhibit a lack of conviction or bias rather than a commitment to neutrality. Such a character thinks of good as better than evil after all, he would rather have good neighbors and rulers than evil ones. Still, he's not personally committed to upholding good in any abstract or universal way. Some true neutral characters, on the other hand, commit themselves philosophically to neutrality. They see good, evil, law, and chaos as prejudices and dangerous extremes. They advocate the middle way of neutrality as the best, most balanced road in the long run. True neutral is the best alignment you can be because it means you act naturally, without prejudice or compulsion. However, true neutral can be a dangerous alignment because it represents apathy, indifference, and a lack of conviction.

Race:
Humans are the most adaptable of the common races. Short generations and a penchant for migration and conquest have made them physically diverse as well. Humans are often unorthodox in their dress, sporting unusual hairstyles, fanciful clothes, tattoos, and the like.

Class:
Druids gain power not by ruling nature but by being at one with it. They hate the unnatural, including aberrations or undead, and destroy them where possible. Druids receive divine spells from nature, not the gods, and can gain an array of powers as they gain experience, including the ability to take the shapes of animals. The weapons and armor of a druid are restricted by their traditional oaths, not simply training. A druid's Wisdom score should be high, as this determines the maximum spell level that they can cast.

Find out What Kind of Dungeons and Dragons Character Would You Be?, courtesy of Easydamus (e-mail)

Thanks for the concern. I'm fine, just very frusterated. MJ, I'm sure you know the feeling too. Too many responsibilities like school and such, at the expense of freedom, and time to actually relax and enjoy life a little. I just want OUT of the rules of society that force us to go to school every morning, work every afternoon, and not have any free time to even scream  about it all. As I walked to class this morning, I saw the blue sky behind the building and I almost just kept walking. It's not right that college students get so stressed they have a pre-midlife crisis and want to do something crazy just to break from it all.
I'm tired of having no money, no time, and no life. The only full free day I ever have is Sunday,(I either have work or school or both every other day) and I just end up cleaning all day Sunday because I couldn't get it done all week, but I'll go crazy if I just leave it a wreck.
Sorry to whine. I'm just... mentally exhausted.

Anyone else feel too responsible and rule abiding for their own good?

Kitty Update:
Possible Names so far:
Gaia -- also called Gaea or Ge - was the Greek goddess of the earth. In Hesiod, Gaia came into existence after Chaos and produced the sky, mountains and sea. With the sky Ouranus, Gaia was the mother of the Titans, Cyclops, and Hecatoncheires. With Pontus, Gaia was the mother of Nereus, Thaumas, Phorcys, Ceto, and Eurybia. In Homer, Gaia is invoked for oaths. Tellus is the Roman equivalent of Gaia.
